articles.author: Steve Holland, Guy Faulconbridge, Olena Harmash
articles.description: Putin said efforts to end the war were "generally on the right track" and that Moscow was ready to work with Ukraine on a potential peace deal.
articles.title: Trump says Russia and Ukraine to start 'immediate' talks on ceasefire

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel pursued its military operation in Gaza after it agreed to lift a two-month-old blockade on aid deliveries that has left the enclave on the brink of famine.
articles.title: Israel kills 20 Palestinians in airstrikes after agreeing to let some aid into Gaza

articles.author: Alistair Smout, Andrew Macaskill, Andrew Gray
articles.description: Britain agreed the most significant reset of defence and trade ties with the European Union since Brexit on Monday after U.S. President Donald Trump's upending of the global order pushed the two sides to move on from their acrimonious divorce.
articles.title: UK strikes EU trade and defence reset in 'new era' for relations

articles.author: David Lawder, Promit Mukherjee, Julia Payne
articles.description: Finance leaders from the Group of Seven democracies will strive for a show of unity when they meet this week on topics other than U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs, including economic security, Ukraine and artificial intelligence cooperation.
articles.title: G7 finance leaders to seek US consensus on non-tariff issues at Canada meeting

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court allowed Donald Trump's administration on Monday to strip about 350,000 Venezuelans living in the United States of a temporary protected status given under his predecessor Joe Biden, as the Republican president moves to ramp up deportations as part of his hardline approach to immigration.
articles.title: US Supreme Court lets Trump end deportation protection for Venezuelans

articles.author: Maria Tsvetkova, Karen Freifeld, David Shepardson
articles.description: The investigation into why a Mexican Navy training ship struck the Brooklyn Bridge on Saturday, shearing the top of its masts, will look into a possible engine failure and the role of a tug boat that assisted it in backing out of its pier, officials said on Monday.
articles.title: Probe of crash of Mexican tall ship into Brooklyn Bridge centers on engine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A judge in Ecuador on Monday ruled former vice president Jorge Glas will face trial for alleged misuse of public funds allocated to rebuild areas affected by a devastating 2016 earthquake.
articles.title: Ecuador judge sends former vice-president Jorge Glas to trial

articles.author: Vladimir Soldatkin
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin, after a call with U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday, said that Moscow was ready to work with Ukraine on a memorandum about a future peace accord and that efforts to end the war in Ukraine were on the right track.
articles.title: Putin agrees with Trump to work with Ukraine on memorandum on possible peace accord

articles.author: Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: Members of the World Health Organization voted emphatically in favour of a potentially groundbreaking global treaty on improving pandemic preparedness at the World Health Assembly on Monday.
articles.title: World Health Organization members vote in favour of global pandemic agreement

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 58 unidentified corpses were found on Monday in a hospital in Tripoli that was under the control of a militia whose leader was killed last week, the interior ministry said.
articles.title: At least 58 corpses found in Libyan hospital, ministry says
